data.name: Knowledge of Creatures (Animate)
data.description: Animated creatures are ones that are created through some form of magic. They don't need to eat, breathe, or sleep. Example: golems, skeletons, and warforged

data.name: Knowledge of Creatures (Beast)
data.description: Beasts are ordinary animals and other creatures akin to them that operate on instinct. Examples: Deer, Owlbears, Squarks

data.name: Knowledge of Creatures (Humanoid)
data.description: Humanoid creatures either are human or resemble humans in form, behavior, facial features, or all three. Most humanoids are bipedal. Examples: elves, gnolls, hobgoblins, and humans.

data.name: Knowledge of Creatures (Immortal)
data.description: Immortals are spirits bound to a plane. Immortals cannot be killed or born, instead their spiritual energy is merely dispersed and will usually later reform. Examples: angels, demons, elementals

data.name: Knowledge of Creatures (Monsters)
data.description: This category covers anything that's not part of the above. Examples: beholders, dragons, and manticores

data.name: Knowledge of Culture (Dragonmarked Houses)
data.description: The Dragonmarked Houses are the economic backbone of Khorvaire. Competency in Dragonmarked Houses means you know the heads of each house, their guilds, and important historical events related to the guild

data.name: Knowledge of Culture (Language)
data.description: When you choose this proficiency you learn one language of your choice. You may choose this proficiency any number of times.

data.name: Knowledge of Culture (Nobility)
data.description: The royal families of the Five Nations do not uniformly hold power over their subjects, but they are still at the center of political power in Khorvaire. Competency in Nobility means you know the ruling families of each of the Five Nations, the order of succession for each, and how to conduct yourself in court and other formal affairs.

data.name: Knowledge of Culture (Religion)
data.description: Religion subtly shapes Khorvaire, with the Church of the Silver Flame, the Sovereign Host, and the Blood of Vol as the most prominent religions. Competency in Religion means you know the beliefs of each faith and important rituals for each.

data.name: Knowledge of Geography (Aeranel)
data.description: Aeranel is the island continent controlled by the elves, off the southeast coast of Khorvaire.

data.name: Knowledge of Geography (Argonessen)
data.description: Argonessen is the mysterious continent of dragons, guarded by barbarians and mystical storms.

data.name: Knowledge of Geography (The Five Nations)
data.description: The Five Nations include Aundair, Breland, the Mournland (Formerly known as Cyre), Karrnath, and Thrane.

data.name: Knowledge of Geography (The Frostfell)
data.description: The Frostfell is a frozen wasteland to the north that has remained mostly unexplored

data.name: Knowledge of Geography (Greater Khorvaire)
data.description: Greater Khorvaire includes all the nations of Khorvaire that seceded during the Last War. These include Darguun, the Demon Wastes, Droamm, the Eldeen Reaches, the Lhazaar Principalities, the Mror Holds, Qbarra, the Shadow Marches, the Talenta Plains, Valenar, and Zilargo.

data.name: Knowledge of Geography (Khyber)
data.description: Khyber is the underworld, filled with demons and aberrations, but also great treasure in the form of Khyber Dragonshards.

data.name: Knowledge of Geography (The Oceans)
data.description: The Oceans of Eberron are full of life, with both monsters and undersea civilizations.

data.name: Knowledge of Geography (Sarlona)
data.description: Sarlona is a mysterious, distant continent to the east of Khorvaire, and also the birthplace of humanity. In the north are barbaric wildlands, in the middle is the empire of Riedra, and in the south lies the rebel state of Adar.

data.name: Knowledge of Geography (Xen'Drik)
data.description: Xen'drik is a jungle continent full of ancient giant ruins and mysterious magic. Xen'drik is home to both the Drow and the Thri-kreen races.

data.name: Knowledge of History (The Last War and Contemporary History)
data.description: The Last War raged on for nearly 100 years. Competency in The Last War and Contemporary History covers the causes of the Last War, the major battles, the creation of the Warforged, the various secessions, and the Treaty of Thronehold.

data.name: Knowledge of History (The Kingdom of Galifar)
data.description: The Kingdom of Galifar was founded almost 1000 years ago in a bloody war of unification. Significant events include the War of the Mark, the founding of the Church of the Silver Flame, and the Lycanthropic purge.

data.name: Knowledge of History (The Age of Dragonmarks)
data.description: The Age of Dragonmarks started over 3,000 years ago, suddenly appearing on particular lineages of gnomes, halflings, elves, dwarves and orcs. Significant events include the migration of humans from Sarlona, the founding of Sharn, and Karrn's war of conquest.

data.name: Knowledge of History (The Age of Monsters)
data.description: The Age of Monsters covers the Dhakaani Empire's rise and fall. Significant events include the Dragon-Elf wars, the first Elven settlements in modern Valenar, and the mythic Dwarven Kingdom of Stone.

data.name: Knowledge of History (The Age of Giants)
data.description: The Age of Giants covers the Giant empires on Xen'drik, the enslavement and escape of the Elves, and the annihilation of the Giant empire by the Dragons of Argonessen.

data.name: Knowledge of History (Pre-History)
data.description: Mythology suggest there were cataclysmic wars that shook the very foundations of Eberron before the Age of Giants, but almost all knowledge of this era has been lost to time.

data.name: Knowledge of The Planes (Daanvi and Kythri)
data.description: The planes of order and chaos, Daanvi and Kythri's impact on the material plane isn't obvious. Daanvi is home to all forms of mechanical creatures, while Kythri is home to miscellaneous elementals.

data.name: Knowledge of The Planes (Dal Quor and Xoriat)
data.description: Collectively known as the psychic planes, Dal Quor and Xoriat are each estranged from the material in their own way. Dal Quor is the plane of dreams, while Xoriat is the plane of madness.

data.name: Knowledge of The Planes (Demiplanes and the Astral Sea)
data.description: The Astral Sea joins the various planes and is home to all sorts of portals. Prominent demiplanes include Baator, home of the devils, and The Dark Realms.

data.name: Knowledge of The Planes (Dolurrh, Irian, and Mabar)
data.description: Each of Dolurrh, Irian, and Mabar relate to the grand cycle of creation and destruction. When they die, mortal souls travel to Dolurrh. Irian constantly produces energy and planar motes, while Mabar consumes and destroys.

data.name: Knowledge of The Planes (Fernia and Risia)
data.description: Fire and ice, Fernia and Risia represent the cruel and dangerous aspects of both heat and cold.

data.name: Knowledge of The Planes (Lammania and Thelanis)
data.description: The wild planes, Lammania represents the raw and real aspects of nature while Thelanis is the realm of the Fae.

data.name: Knowledge of The Planes (Shavarath and Syrania)
data.description: Representing War and Peace, Shavarath and Syrania are each important planar hubs, containing the highest densities of civilized

data.name: Performance (Acting)
data.description: Proficiency in acting covers live theater. Proficiency in acting is suggested for creating disguises.

data.name: Performance (Music)
data.description: Proficiency in music covers every instrument, singing, and whistling. It's suggested that a few forms are specified as the ones the character is proficient in.

data.name: Performance (Storytelling)
data.description: Storytelling covers anything from dramatic recounts of heroism to spooky campfire stories. Proficiency in storytelling is suggested for bluffs and deception.

data.name: Alchemist's tools
data.description: Alchemist's tools allow characters to craft potions with herbs and other reagents they gather or purchase.

data.name: Artisan's Tools
data.description: Artisan's tools cover a large variety of tools, pick two each time you choose this competency. You may choose this proficiency any number of times.

data.name: Forgery Tools
data.description: Forgery tools are used to create fake documents

data.name: Poisoner's Tools
data.description: Poison tools are used to create poisons that can be ingested or applied to a weapon.

data.name: Thieves Tools
data.description: Thieves tools are used to pick locks and disable traps.

data.name: Boating
data.description: Boating is used to control watercraft. Examples include small sailboats and large elemental galleons.

data.name: Driving
data.description: Driving is used to control land vehicles. Examples include chariots and elemental land carts.

data.name: Gambling
data.description: Proficiency in Gambling gives a character a leg up in any games of chance.

data.name: Piloting
data.description: Piloting is used to control air vehicles. Examples include a Sharn Sky Skiff or an Airship.
